intro: Amsinckia sparsiseta, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Amsinckia sparsiseta is often found in sandy or rocky soils along dry streambeds and slopes.
